intro: Velaea texana, commonly known as the Texas velvetleaf, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States. It is characterized by its broad, heart-shaped leaves that are covered in fine, soft hairs, giving it a velvety texture. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in clusters, typically during the summer months. It is often found in disturbed soils and along roadsides, thriving in warm, sunny environments. Velaea texana is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants.
